byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Andy Newman, Sarah Maslin Nir, William K. Rashbaum, Rick Rojas, Nate Schweber, Kirk Semple, Michael Schwirtz and Michael Winerip. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

abstract: Details that have surfaced about manhunt in northern New York State for escaped convicts Richard W Matt and David Sweat suggest search was hampered by squabbling and poor communication between federal, state and local law enforcement agencies.
lead_paragraph: A week distinguished by DNA discoveries and well-organized sweeps was the final stage of a 23-day slog that was hampered, at times, by missed signals.

headline.main: Squabbling, Hesitation and Luck Had Roles in Manhunt for New York Prison Escapees
headline.print_headline: Squabbling, Hesitation and Luck Had Roles in Capture

snippet: A week distinguished by DNA discoveries and well-organized sweeps was the final stage of a 23-day slog that was hampered, at times, by missed signals.
